meta.name: Sneaker Price Drop Alerts with Bright Data & n8n

parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:

   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# ğŸ‘Ÿ **Sneaker Price Drop Alert Automation**

> *Track sneaker prices on resale sites and get alerted via email when prices drop below your set budget.*

---

## ğŸŸ¢ **SECTION 1: Scheduled Price Scraping via Bright Data**

### ğŸ§­ **Nodes Involved**:

1. ğŸ•’ **Schedule Trigger â€” â€œRun Price Monitor Everydayâ€**
2. ğŸŒ **HTTP Request â€” â€œBright Data Scraperâ€**

### ğŸ§  **What This Section Does**:

This section **automatically kicks off your sneaker tracking** every day without needing to press any buttons.

* **ğŸ•’ Schedule Trigger**: Think of this like an alarm clock for your workflow. It runs once a day (or more often if you want).
* **ğŸŒ HTTP Request (Bright Data)**: Uses Bright Dataâ€™s **Web Unlocker** to scrape StockX or GOAT without getting blocked. This handles bot protection and gives you the full HTML content.

### ğŸ› ï¸ **Beginner Tip**:

You donâ€™t have to be a coder or open the browser. Just schedule it and forget itâ€”n8n + Bright Data handles it.

---

## ğŸŸ¡ **SECTION 2: Extract Sneaker Info from HTML**

### ğŸ§± **Nodes Involved**:

3. ğŸ§¾ **HTML Extractor â€” â€œextractHtmlContentâ€**
4. ğŸ“¦ **Function â€” â€œExtract Title & Priceâ€**

### ğŸ§  **What This Section Does**:

This section **pulls out useful info from the webpage** â€” like the sneaker's name and its price.

* **ğŸ§¾ HTML Extractor**: Converts raw HTML into a structured format so we can easily extract text.
* **ğŸ“¦ Extract Title & Price**: Goes through the HTML and collects the sneaker name and price. It also converts prices from strings like `"$223"` to usable numbers like `223`.

### ğŸ› ï¸ **Beginner Tip**:

Webpages are full of clutter. This part filters that clutter and gets only what you care about: name + price.

---

## ğŸ”´ **SECTION 3: Check for Deals & Send Alerts**

### ğŸ“¤ **Nodes Involved**:

5. âš–ï¸ **IF Node â€” â€œCheck Price < Thresholdâ€**
6. ğŸ“§ **Gmail Node â€” â€œSend Price Drop Email Alertâ€**
7. â›” **No Operation â€” â€œDo Nothingâ€**

### ğŸ§  **What This Section Does**:

This is the brain of the automation. It **decides whether a sneaker's price is good enough to alert you**, and then takes action.

* **âš–ï¸ IF Node**: Checks if the sneaker's price is below your target (e.g. \$250). You can change this number anytime.
* **ğŸ“§ Gmail Node**: If a good deal is found, sends you an alert with the sneakerâ€™s name and current price.
* **â›” No Operation**: If the price is too high, it simply does nothing and ends the workflow.

### ğŸ› ï¸ **Beginner Tip**:

You're not flooded with emailsâ€”only alerted when a good deal hits your threshold. Smart automation = peace of mind.

---

## âœ… **Why This Workflow is Powerful for Beginners**

| Feature             | Benefit                                          |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| â° Scheduled         | Set it once, runs forever on autopilot.          |
| ğŸ’¡ No Coding Needed | All logic is visual and editable.                |
| ğŸ’Œ Smart Alerts     | Only get emails when prices are *actually* good. |
| ğŸ” Web Unlocker     | Gets past tough sites like StockX with ease.     |

---

## ğŸ“¦ Bonus Suggestion:

Want to track multiple sneaker models? Just **clone the HTTP node and update the query** (e.g. `Jordan+4`, `Yeezy+Foam`, etc.)

---

parameters.subject: =The sneaker {{ $json.title }} has dropped below your threshold price.
